commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Yay! First one here! Or not. You're early.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh, hey Ai.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Hm, you look like you have something on your mind.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Hello. Let's do our best at practice today!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Hey Emma-chi, come over here. This one is thinking hard about something!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: N-No I'm not.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Hm? You're right, Ai! Look at that creased brow. What's up?

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Hello.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Hey! If it isn't the first year trio. Get over here, the club president is acting weird!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: D-Don't surround me like that.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: We can't help it. Ai said you were acting weird.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: If you aren't getting enough sleep, I can give you some advice.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: We'll help you with whatever your problem is, not just a lack of sleep.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: You've been acting strange all morning. What's wrong?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: You always hear us out about our problems, so we want to hear yours, too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Sorry to make you guys worry. It's nothing serious. I've just been thinking about how pathetic I am for not putting to use my meeting with Aqours and μ's.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: What do you mean?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: When I went to see Aqours, I thought we really connected through the festival and stuff. It felt...fulfilling.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Then we had the contest with μ's and even went to their live show. It was a lot of fun.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: It was fun, but it made me realize how inexperienced I am, and it got me all depressed.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: You shouldn't worry about stuff like that.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I might have cried a lot from losing against them, but I'm not sad. It was a good experience!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hahaha, thanks Kasumi. I wanted to see you all on that stage though. *Sigh* Aqours and μ's are amazing. I can't even imagine us catching up to their level right now.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Don't say that. We've done a lot of great things at the Nijigasaki High School Idol Club.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: And a lot of it is thanks to all your support!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Yeah, Setsu is right.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Hold on, I think our club president just said "right now," didn't you?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Chuckle* You're sharp, Karin. I can't imagine it right now, but I think it was a good experience that showed us our current strength.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I know for a fact the things we saw in Aqours and μ's will help us in the future. It's a little depressing for the time being though.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Sleeping is the best when you're depressed. Want to go take a nap with me?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: No thanks!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: You don't have to be so excited about refusing.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I don't have any time to be depressed! We'll overcome this and make our way up to Aqours' and μ's' level!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Right. It's only natural they're a lot better than us. It's all up to how much work we put in to close that gap.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Setsuna is right. If we ever have another competition, we're definitely going to win against them.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I doubt the outcome would change if you went up against Nico again, Kasumi.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Are you taking her side?! Traitor! You should be on my side!

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Ahahaha!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Whew...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (No matter how many times I look over this music, I just can't imagine Nijigasaki singing it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I feel like I put everything I could into this song. I think it's good, but not a song for the Nijigasaki High School Idol Club.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (It's not us. But then again, what is "us"? Aqours and μ's have that something that defines them in their songs.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh, it's no use. My thoughts are going in circles. I wish I could talk to someone. Hm? I wonder who it is. Wha--?! Chika?!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Hello! It's Chika. How are ya?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Ch-Chika, why are you calling?!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I just remembered we never properly thanked you for helping out with the festival.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Whoa, Mari?!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Good evening! How are you? We're calling this a thank you call, but we're really just gathering intel.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Come on, you two. Don't be so jarring. Sorry about that.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Actually, Honoka told us you lost in the song-off against Maki. Chika was worried and decided to call you.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Th-That's right! We had a contest against them and then went to see them live! It made me think μ's is really amazing. How are they so different from us?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Even though I know something is different, I can't figure out what it is! What do you think defines you? What defines Aqours?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: C-Calm down. What defines Aqours, you ask?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Hmm... What is it, I wonder?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: It has to be the mysterious, ominous aura emanating from Yohane!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Yoshiko, you should probably take this more seriously, zura.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I'm not Yoshiko, I'm Yohane! And I am being serious!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: You know, we had the same problem. Worrying about it won't help you find the answer though.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You guys had the same problem as me?

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Of course we did. But just like Ruby said, worrying about it didn't help one bit.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: We realized that all we could do was be the best at what we can do.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What we can do...

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: We believe doing that will help us find our own way to shine some day.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's the strength of Aqours. I wonder if Nijigasaki-- No, if I can maintain the same mentality.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: If you're that worried about it, why don't you just ask Maki?

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: It'd be a lot faster to just ask her how she writes the music for μ's.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Yes, Riko is right.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: If only we were nearer to you, we could listen to all of your problems.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: I wish Yoshiko could use her fallen angel powers to bring us to Odaiba, zura.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I told you, I'm Yohane!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: *Scoff* Unfortunately, it's a full moon tonight. The bright light of the full moon weakens us fallen angels.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hahaha! Thanks guys! I feel a little better. I'll try getting in contact with Maki.
